metadata.title: CVE-2024-43877 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:media: pci: ivtv: Add check for DMA map resultIn case DMA fails, 'dma->SG_length' is 0. This value is later used toaccess 'dma->SGarray[dma->SG_length - 1]', which will cause out ofbounds access.Add check to return early on invalid value. Adjust warnings accordingly.Found by Linux Verification Center (linuxtesting.org) with SVACE.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-43877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
